fields.description:
Although it is not very painful to convert an existing repository from hg to git or viceversa, using hg-fast-export for example, the issue of preserving users, wiki and issues tracker still remains.

It would be very useful, given that you offer more than just a repo, to have that hg-git switch implemented.

Maybe you can even consider maintaining dual repos and synchronizing them, so everyone can access them using both hg or git. Just thinking aloud, I don't know if that is even possible, but it would surely be a nice feature.
fields.summary: Allow change / convert from mercurial / hg to git and viceversa

fields.description:
.docx files show up as a binary in Bitbucket and yet show line changes in Git Gui on Windows.

Is there a possible future addition of docx interpretation within the bitbucket site?
fields.summary: .docx shows up as a binary?

fields.description:
I want to grant a client access to the issue tracker, but not the code itself.\\
Can this be achieved right now? If not, could you make it possible?
fields.summary: Allow granting read access to the issue tracker only

fields.description: Searching for a file in a private repo that exists will redirect you to a login screen (example: https://bitbucket.org/kevinburke/blog-theme/src/ca315864172e/apt). However searching for files with similar names will 404 (example: https://bitbucket.org/kevinburke/blog-theme/src/ca315864172e/nope). This could allow a determined attacker to determine the folder structure and files contained in Bitbucket private repositories (as well as determine the existence of private repositories).
fields.summary: Existence and file structure of private repos can be determined by HTTP status codes

fields.description: In some readmes I count over 30 words in one line. Look at several blogging plattforms, and see how they average at around 20 words per line. Please increase the font size by a bit for the readmes displayed on the Overview tab, and reduce the words per line by increasing the margins on the left and right side.
fields.summary: Limit rendered width of README to improve readability (BB-10711)

fields.description: When you upload a symbolic link to the webhosting it just displays it as a text file with the target of the link as it's contest.  I would like to link user.bitbucket.org/docs/latest to the latest version.  I could use a redirect but this seems more elegant because bookmarks will always point to the latest docs.
fields.summary: Symlinks are not followed when encountered in a host repository (BB-4165)

fields.description: This is surprising because definition lists are enabled in the wiki, so I expected them to be parsed in the "README.md" files.
fields.summary: Definition lists are disabled in README.md

fields.description: Email and Email Diff services currently send e-mails from the address *commits-noreply@bitbucket.org*. This creates a moderation issue for public repositories that may wish to send the e-mails to a mailing list. Such mailing lists are typically read-only and configured to only accept posts from known addresses. Once a mailing list allows *commits-noreply@bitbucket.org* to post messages then anyone can set up the mailing list as the target of their repo's services without the consent of the mailing list administrators/moderators. The Email and Email Diff services should therefore be updated to use a repo-specific from address along the lines of *//USER//-//REPO//-commits-noreply@bitbucket.org*. I don't think there shuold be any option to change this.
fields.summary: Repo-specific from address for Email services (BB-4161)

fields.description: i guess it shouldn't be hard because the "email diff" service/broker already includes the diff content.
fields.summary: service POST should be able to receive the diff of changesets (BB-4160)

fields.description:
One of my projects contains a C++ include file without a suffix (following the scheme used in standard C++ library). Thus, it is impossible to determine the correct syntax highlighting by filename and bitbucket fails to highlight it, as you can see here:

https://bitbucket.org/mgorny/libh2oxx/src/016ef53d5fe3/include/h2o

As you can see, the file ends with a vim modeline specifying the correct syntax. Maybe bitbucket could parse that in order to determine the language for syntax highlighting.
fields.summary: Parsing modelines for syntax highlighting (BB-4159)

fields.description:
I understand you might have good reasons not to automatically convert repositories from hg to git and vice-versa, however having to delete and re-create a whole repository is not really optimal: that could be improved.

You could allow us to change repository type, deleting all the sources, but leaving intact the collaborators, issues and wiki; we would locally manage repository conversion and upload it again, without having to worry about all the rest.
fields.summary: Allow to manually convert a project without having to re-create it

fields.description:
I was previously a member of an organization that had private repositories.  I "hearted" or followed a few of those.  Then I left the organization and I continue to get information regarding those repositories even though I no-longer have access to them.

When I try and un-follow them, it does not work.

I assume this is because I no longer have access I can't complete the un-follow function on those repositories

Expected behavior it seems would be that when a user is removed from the organization all private repositories belonging to that organization are un-followed by the removed member.
fields.summary: Unable to un-follow private repositories I no longer have access to

fields.description:
Hi BitBucket team,\\
First of all, thanks for the great work you are doing.

I have recently begun using BitBucket. I don't have much experience of using open source versioning and collaboration tools. From this newbie point of view, there are 2 navigational improvements that I would like to suggest:

# Have an easier way to browse the directories of a repository. Currently if I want to see all the files in any directory, there seems to be no direct link on the repo home. One can go to commits, click on the name of any file, then see the directory structure broken down by path tokens and be able to click each token to see the files in that directory.
# There is also no "list" or "contents" of wiki pages. If the assumption is that wiki owners should create the links to inner pages from the home wiki, then it's okay but again, not obvious. One would expect to see a list of the wiki pages in the repository.

Again, thanks for the efforts.

Siddhartha
fields.summary: Navigational improvements

fields.description:
If you visit for example: https://bb.kjarni.cc/

Which is set up as a "Custom Domain", you will notice that you get a very massive certificate error.

=== Possible Solutions ===

* Not directing me to a secure site under the CNAME'd domain.
* Using a non-secure site to redirect me from the CNAME'd domain to the actual domain.
* Using a non-secure site to create an iframe to the target site.
* Making "Custom domains" be a subdomain of bitbucket.org using a certificate with *.bitbucket.org as an alias (see kjarni.cc's certificate as an example).

Good luck
fields.summary: Custom domain feature is unusable

fields.description:
Service brokers, like POST, only trigger on pushes.  It would be nice if a major event like merging a pull request also triggered services.

This is a major pain for integrating repositories with JIRA. Unless JIRA is told to force sync with the repository, it is never notified of commits that were merged in via a pull request.
fields.summary: Git pull requests should trigger the POST service (BB-4147)

fields.description:
I have a repository layout that combines several of my projects (all in bitbucket) as subprojects, like this:\\
{{{\\
a      -> git@bitbucket.org:me/a.git\\
lib/b  -> git@bitbucket.org:me/b.git\\
lib/c  -> git@bitbucket.org:me/c.git\\
z      -> git@bitbucket.org:me/z.git\\
}}}

In the sourcebrowser this shows up as:\\
{{{\\
/:\\
a [############]  (links to project and commit)\\
lib               (empty dir)\\
z [############]  (links to project and commit)

/lib:\\
(empty)\\
}}}

I would expect the following:\\
{{{\\
/:\\
a [############]  (links to project and commit)\\
lib               (dir containing b and c)\\
z [############]  (links to project and commit)

/lib:\\
b [############]  (links to project and commit)\\
c [############]  (links to project and commit)\\
}}}

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm happy so far, but I wanted to say I think it is misleading to say:\\
"you can import all of your existing source code from Subversion directly into Bitbucket".\\
On close inspection, for subversion, you only import the head - not the whole repo, which is the whole point of a repo! And the link in:\\
"We recommend reading the blog entry,"Goodbye Subversion, Hello Mercurial: A Migration Guide" to learn about best practices when migrating to DVCS from Subversion."\\
Is not the best place to start. It took me another hour of research to find the best practices for us with Windows32, so I think it would be much better if you could link to a faq/support page where you summarise best options for different situations.

FYI, we found this was best for us - great recent tutorial with screenshots:\\
http://nicobo.net/articles/migrating-subversion-mercurial

Cheers,

Eric
fields.summary: Misleading: Migrating Subversion to Mecurial

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I have a Readme.md at my (public) repository https://bitbucket.org/mathematicalcoffee/status-area-horizontal-spacing-gnome-shell-extension.

It has some images (the links work, I checked) and inline code in backticks, as per Markdown syntax. The inline code and images have stopped rendering on the Readme.md in the Overview tab. I've attached a screenshot to show what I mean.

I've checked with the python {{markdown_py}}, and the syntax is correct (when I do {{markdown_py Readme.md > Readme.htm}} and look at the resulting file in a browser, it displays as I expect).

What is causing this?

cheers!
fields.summary: Markdown: Readme.md is not rendering properly

fields.description:
When paragraphs in README.md are written as multiple lines (as happens when composing Markdown in Emacs and using M-q to insert linebreaks), content is truncated. See https://bitbucket.org/dstu/readme-truncation-demo (and the source of its README.md) for an example.

From the HTML generated on that project's overview page, it is apparent that, when a paragraph consists of multiple lines, content after the first linebreak is discarded. The expected behavior is that it will appear in the formatted output, with the extra linebreaks elided.

Dumping the text of that project's README.md into http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/dingus verifies this.
fields.summary: README.md displayed on overview has truncated lines

fields.description:
Mainly missing support for {{{hn.}}} and {{{@code@}}}. Example: https://bitbucket.org/edogawaconan/moebooru

Document was tested using [[http://redcloth.org/|Try RedCloth]] and [[http://textile.sitemonks.com/|Textile Test Page]].

fields.description:
I would say this is a security issue.

This is not standard situation as your commit is used in private repository where you don't have access.

A way to reproduce this is to use Symfony2 Standard as a base of your private application. Importing commit history of Symfony2 to your repo will show your newly created repo for every contributor to Symfony2 Standard repository who has account in BitBucket (and probably other open source projects).

For example right now I can see in "Recent activity" that I have

"committed to symfony-mlk

e7b7b0f36646 replaced app/bootstrap wildcard with explicit entry this could be done as {{app/bootstrap_cache.php.cache}} is no longer created and used (see 8a7be4fdcac34685757439f86fbd64bee6643cc8) 3 days ago\\
"

"symfony-mlk" is a private repo which is not mine and I am not allowed to view it - so I shouldn't even see the name of this repo in my activity stream and know when this repository was updated to my commit from Symfony2 repo. This may be security risk for currently deployed projects with readable repo name (e.g. host name = repo name).
fields.summary: Your commits in repositories which you are not allowed to view are shown in newsfeed (BB-4112)

fields.description:
Hi great service and great site, recommended a few of my friends and have been very pleased.

In the 'Import an existing repository' text box where the commands for doing things like git remote add origin etc for the specific repo are, the $ signs stop me from being able to copy and paste the entire chunk on Mac OS X. Basically terminal returns with -Bash $ command not found.

The alternative is copy pasting line by line, but if there's a way of getting around this that'd be great!

Thanks,

Marty

fields.description:
https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=bitbucket.org gives a poor rating for your https set-up, mainly due to support for broken ciphers (including 40-bit variants) and protocols (SSL 2.0).

Please consider addressing some of these issues, to make the internet a more fun place to be.
fields.summary: Improve HTTPS security (BB-4110)

fields.description: Hi, I have been hosting a static website at neurolab.bitbucket.org for several years now, and I just noticed that it is not working -- I get a 404 trying to get to http://neurolab.bitbucket.org  The mercurial repo neurolab.bitbucket.org is still there...
fields.summary: static website disappeared

fields.description:
When I log in and go to: https://bitbucket.org/repo/mine

I see my repos and they all have 4 (and one even 6) followers listed. When I click on https://bitbucket.org/mvdkleijn/microblogs/zealots for example to see who those followers are, I only see myself...

Am I not seeing followers that are there or is the count buggy?
fields.summary: Incorrect followers count?

fields.description:
For one of my repositories, commits are not showing up neither in the dashboard nor in the newsfeed. This affects only one particular repository, but not others.

The commits themselves are in the repository and show up on the repository overview page.
fields.summary: Commits are not showing in the newsfeed

fields.description:
I would like to propose adding a couple of fields to downloads:

* Release notes
* Associated changeset
fields.summary: Enhancements to Downloads (BB-4109)

fields.description:
project:

https://bitbucket.org/huacnlee/nblive

CentOS release 5.7 (Final), git-1.7.7.5

ssh key:\\
{{{\\
ssh-rsa  huacnlee@yeiscity.com\\
}}}
fields.summary: can clone with ssh even add id_rsa.pub again and again
Error when uploading

fields.description:
* 2 users: user1 and user2
* user1 create git repo repo1
* user1 give acces to that repo1 to user2
* user1 make some commits on repo1 (this appears on the dashboard of user2 with link ../user1/repo1)
* user2 create his own repo with the same name repo1
* user2 make some commits in his repo1
* user1 make some commits in his repo1
* user2 pull this commits in his repo1 and push it
* user2 now see on the dasboard links like that: user1 commited to ../user2/repo1 (but user1 dont commited on user2/repo1, he commited on user1/repo1)

It's not so bad bug but it's confusing
fields.summary: Show repos on the dashboard with owner/reponame instead of just reponame (BB-4117)

fields.description:
Under certain light conditions it is very difficult to see which tab is active.\\
Overview, Downloads, Pull requests, Source, …\\
They all are shown in “dark white”, while the active tab is just a tiny bit whiter. It would be nice to somehow indicate more strongly which tab is currently active. This could be done by chosing a slightly darker background color for unselected tabs, or by making the soft lines around the active tab thicker.
fields.summary: More distinct colors for (un-)selected tabs

fields.description:
When looking at commit messages then sometimes one can only see part of the message, because the column has a fixed size.\\
It would be nice that as long a commit message is shorter than, say, 1000 chars, that a tooltip pops up which shows the full message.\\
This way I can stay in the commit view without having to click on the specific message first, in order to be able to read it.

Example:\\
the full commit message:\\
{{{\\
commit: Confirm dialog to add new unknown files is now optional; confirm dialog to delete files is now optional\\
}}}

But on the commit tab I can only see:\\
{{{\\
commit: Confirm dialog to add new unknown files is now optional; confirm dialog to\\
}}}\\
and the {{{to}}} already fades, to indicate that the message continues.
fields.summary: Commit Tab: show full commit message in a tooltip on mouse over (BB-4107)

fields.description: I would like to create a code in Standard ML, but I could not find the option in the language bar.
fields.summary: missing language option

fields.description:
Cloning a repo to add an image to a wiki page is very inconvenient, and not required by any other wiki software (except Fossil?).

Could we have a direct upload option please?
fields.summary: Easier way to add images to wiki (BB-4108)

fields.description:
I have a repository on Bitbucket, which contains a subrepository, also hosted on Bitbucket. Should the subrepository on the code tab link to the repository's source?

(Cross-posted from google groups, where it didn't get any attention.)
fields.summary: Linking Subrepositories

fields.description: Please add a license tab to the project page. Although each project can add a license to its wiki or source, many do not. Even for those that do, there is no uniform way for finding this important information.
fields.summary: Add license details to repository admin (BB-1628)

fields.description:
Right as far as I can tell it's only possible to leave comment in the commit scope.

it would be great if we could leave a comment on a specific file in a commit or even better if we could do it on a specific line.

github allows you to do this and it really helps with pull requests and code reviews.

Thanks,
fields.summary: being able to comment on lower level than the whole commit.

fields.description:
The Atom feed icon appears next to the RSS feed icon for my newsfeed.

Unfortunately it doesn't appear on any of my project pages next to the RSS icon with text: "RSS".

*Could you please add Atom feed subscription capability for per/project?*

Thanks,

Samuel Marks
fields.summary: Atom feed icon doesn't appear on project page

fields.description:
It appears that bitbucket is suffering from the same bug as reported on the subversion mailing list about github:

http://comments.gmane.org/gmane.comp.version-control.subversion.devel/133763
fields.summary: subversion 1.7 client

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/ritave/olafhackaton/changeset/24afc1d3329a\\
In this commit I changed some files, added new ones and changed symbolic links into real files with the same name. Diff viewer shows all files but info reports that no changes happened in any file (where they were changes), but one, where it shows changes that aren't even in a file (symbolic link before).
fields.summary: Diff in a commit outputs untrue info (BB-4106)

fields.description: It would be great if bitbucket had the ability to create home pages for repository's like git-hub. Create your own project page that you can link to externally. I know you can setup a wiki but what I'm talking about here is a web page with links and custom panels etc.
fields.summary: Support GitHub-style pages for repositories and teams (BB-4105)

fields.description: I am looking through my repository on bitbucket and noticing that in the root directory the file are being shown associated with the commit messages but in the sub directory all my files are showing with "----" instead of date modified which is odd because some of them I have changed since first commit.
fields.summary: Date changed and commit messages not assosciated!

fields.description:
I would love the ability to be able to save my custom built queries along side the built in "All", "Open" and "My Issues" searches on a per project basis.

Then I could save "New issues" or "My New Issues" or whatever the project needs.

This is //trivial// because I can save the query in a bookmark (kudos) but that's a bit of a pain.
fields.summary: Add the ability to save Issue Search Queries alongside the pre set queries.

fields.description:
Could you please add MKD extension as a markdown extension? A lot of systems are still using this and it would be a lot more convenient than changing all the extensions.

Thanks :)
fields.summary: MKD as well as MD for README's

fields.description:
Here is a description of DOT language: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DOT_language

In short, it is a language to create graphs from text files, like a programming language.\\
Graphviz creates raster (and vertor too if I remember correctly) images from it, and doxygen is known to use Graphviz to generate class diagrams and call graphs when it is available.

If the wiki were able to read such files (well, or to ask to graphviz to generate it from a stored DOT file), it could give us the possibility to use the wiki directly as a design tool. Imagine you work on a class diagram with some other people. Actually, you can only use formats not easy to alter, so, raster images (png, by example) or vector images (svg). You could also use dia files, but in any case, you will need a software to modify them.\\
Using DOT files will allow everyone to edit diagrams with a simple text editor, exactly like a wiki page.

I know, we can actually send dot source file into wiki aside with an image, and the man who want to read can just view the the image.\\
If he want to edit, he can alter source and generate new the image, and then send both of them. But this is an heavy and not user friendly workaround.

For implementation of such a feature, I guess that using a script like the one actually used on the wiki could be ok. Just create a new checkbox "DOT file" when user click on "New" and replace the action taken by the "preview" button by a request to graphviz to generate an image from a command-line. (I think svg is the more interesting, because it is as lightweight as an html file and use client computer to render. Thanks of that, it can be sized automatically to the best size of client computer)
fields.summary: using DOT language to generate diagrams in wiki

fields.description:
Hi,

I work on authorship at Google.  I'd like to see bitbucket search results annotated with author names and faces.  To do so:

# Replace the humans.txt rel="author" with a link to the bitbucket user profile that 'owns' that page.  For example:

https://bitbucket.org/thegeekinside/dotfiles/src/03659e47bdd9/git/gitconfig

should have an author link pointed at

https://bitbucket.org/thegeekinside

# Add rel="me" to website links entered on user profiles.  For example on https://bitbucket.org/thegeekinside the link to http://www.thegeekinside.net/ should have the rel="me" attribute.

I'm available at plindner@google.com if you want to talk more.  Thanks!
fields.summary: Add authorship markup to bitbucket.org (BB-4104)

fields.description:
We are migrating to bitbucket, and bringing several repositories in from multiple locations.  Since we have so many repositories, it would be nice to be able to group certain repositories together, similar to folders, etc.

Even if the groups are just for display and not reflected in the Url, the feature would be nice.

A similar idea would be to Tag repositories, and thus we could use the Tags to filter the repositories page easily, displaying the tags on the repo page.
fields.summary: Group Repositories

fields.description: When I select a branch in a git repository, I expect to have a commit list  filtered by branch selection but I'm getting always the same list.
fields.summary: Commit list is not filtered by branch selection.
